title: Simple circuits - rank the numbers of closed loops

content.question: A circuit contains a lightbulb, a resistor, a closed switch, and a battery, as shown in the figure. The number of closed circuit loops containing the lightbulb, resistor, switch, and battery are <math alttext="N sub L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>L</mtext></msub></math>, <math alttext="N sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub></math>, <math alttext="N sub S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>S</mtext></msub></math>, and <math alttext="N sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>, respectively. Which of the following correctly ranks the number of closed circuit loops that contain each circuit element?

choices.label: <math alttext="N sub B, equals N sub L, which equals N sub R, which equals N sub S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>L</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>S</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="N sub B, equals N sub S, which is greater than N sub L, which equals N sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>S</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>L</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="N sub L, is greater than N sub B, which equals N sub R, which equals N sub S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>L</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>S</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="N sub R, is greater than N sub B, which equals N sub L, which equals N sub S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>L</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>S</mtext></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="N sub B, equals N sub L, which equals N sub R, which equals N sub S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>L</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>S</mtext></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
